Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gently \Gen"tly\, adv. In a gentle manner. [1913 Webster]
My mistress gently chides the fault I made. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]

gently adv 1: in a gradual manner; "a gently sloping terrain" 2: in a gentle manner; "he talked gently to the injured animal" [syn: {mildly}] 3: with little weight or force; "she kissed him lightly on the forehead" [syn: {lightly}, {softly}]
